article.title: Stochastic PDEs on graphs as scaling limits of discrete interacting systems

choices: A biased voter model (BVM) on a continuous graph.
A discrete lattice representing a discretized graph used for a BVM.
A visualization of the diffusion process on a continuous graph.
A network of host cells used for studying viral co-infections.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the purpose of this figure?
choices: To illustrate the concept of neighbors in a BVM.
To show how demes are enumerated along an edge in a discretized graph.
To demonstrate the difference between internal and external edges.
To visualize the application of the discrete Laplacian operator.

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the scalings in Formula (2) represent?
choices: Parameters controlling the behavior of the space-time white noise.
The relationship between microscopic parameters and macroscopic parameters in the scaling limit of a BVM.
Conditions for the existence and uniqueness of solutions to a stochastic FKPP equation.
The rate of convergence of a BVM to a stochastic FKPP equation.
A system of interacting ItË†o SDEs.
A stochastic FKPP equation on a graph with piecewise constant coefficients.
The dynamics of a branching coalescing E-diffusion.
The gluing condition for a continuous function on a graph.
